qa.name: Sophie
qa.appearance: Small, with curly red hair and freckles

hf.name: Mr. Whiskers
hf.appearance: Tall, anthropomorphic rabbit with blue fur

tr.name: Mom
tr.appearance: Mid-thirties, tired eyes but warm smile

json_to_edit.voice_over: Sometimes, the line between imagination and reality blurs in the most unexpected ways.
json_to_edit.description: Sophie's imaginary friend, Mr. Whiskers, suddenly becomes real, causing chaos and wonder.
json_to_edit.name: Imaginary Reality
json_to_edit.scene_summary: Sophie's imaginary rabbit friend, Mr. Whiskers, unexpectedly becomes real, leading to a night of adventure and self-discovery.

qa.action: Sophie's cozy bedroom bathed in moonlight, stuffed animals scattered around.

hf.action: Sophie sitting on her bed, talking animatedly to an empty space beside her.

tr.action: Sophie's eyes widening in disbelief as a shimmer of light appears next to her.

xc.action: Mr. Whiskers materializes in a burst of sparkles, looking as shocked as Sophie.

ka.action: Sophie and Mr. Whiskers tumble off the bed in surprise, knocking over a lamp.

fn.action: Mom's concerned face as she opens the bedroom door, investigating the noise.

af.action: Mom frozen in the doorway, staring in disbelief at Mr. Whiskers.

qo.action: Sophie introducing a very real Mr. Whiskers to her astounded mother.

label.rationale:
we need to update the weather in the scene from "clear night" to "stormy night". this change will affect not only the weather field but also other aspects of the scene that are related to the weather. we should update the lighting, ambience sound keywords, and possibly some of the shot descriptions to reflect this stormy atmosphere. here's how we'll make these changes:

1. change the "weather" field from "clear night" to "stormy night".
2. update the "lighting" to reflect a stormy night, changing it from "soft, dreamlike glow" to "dark with occasional flashes of lightning".
3. modify the "ambience_sound_keywords" to include storm-related sounds.
4. adjust the first shot (qa) description to reflect the stormy weather.
5. update the sfx_keywords in relevant shots to include storm-related sounds.

these changes will create a more cohesive and atmospheric scene that aligns with the new stormy weather condition.
